Title: Probing into the Fairness of Large Language Models: A Case Study of ChatGPT
Abstract: understanding and addressing unfairness in large language model are crucial for responsible artificial intelliegence deployment. however there is a limited number of quantitative analyses and in depth studies regarding fairness evaluations in large language model especially when applying large language model to high stakes fields. this work aims to fill this gap by providing a systematic evaluation of the effectiveness and fairness of large language model using chatgpt as a study case. we focus on assessing chatgpt‚äôs performance in high takes fields including education criminology finance and healthcare. to conduct a thorough evaluation we consider both group fairness and individual fairness metrics. we also observe the disparities in chatgpt‚äôs outputs under a set of biased or unbiased prompts. this work contributes to a deeper understanding of large language model‚äô fairness performance facilitates bias mitigation and fosters the development of responsible artificial intelliegence systems. code and data are open sourced on github 1.
